intro: Senecio iscoensis, commonly known as the Iscoensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered a valuable species for ecological studies and potential pharmaceutical applications.
